title: I"m trying to download my deceased son's gmail account.  I've installed Mozilla Thunderbird, now what?
content:
I'm trying to download my deceased son's Gmail account. 1.) They sent me the info to download Mozilla Thunderbird, which I did. 2.) Then it says to close after you have completed the installation. 3.) Open the following path/folder on your computer. 4.) Open Windows XP/2000, the path is C:\Documents and Settings\[User Name]\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\xxxxxxxx.default\

My question is: I have Windows 11 Home, does that make a difference as to what I type in the path/folder? Also, where do I go to get to that path/folder?

I only have 30 days to figure this out and then have to refile a legal retrieval again to obtain the emails. I received the notice on the 16 of May and have not been able to figure this out. Google said in order to open the email content use Mozilla Thunderbird or any other program capable of reading ".mbox" format files.

Any help would be greatly appreciated. I look forward to hearing from someone soon. Thank you!

L. McClellan lynnemcclellan@gmail.com
creator: lynnemcclellan

title: Thunderbird local folders disappeared
content:
After years of using Thunderbird (PC) as a POP email client without issues, one day my client discovered the body text of his emails wouldn't display: not in the preview pane, nor when the email was opened into a separate tab. I tried the recommendations I found online (repair the folders, rebuild them by deleting the associated .msf files, relaunch in Troubleshoot Mode) but none fixed the problem. I decided to create a new Thunderbird profile to see if the problem persisted—but the password I had for the account didn't work, so I wasn't able to finish the test. I reassigned the original profile as the default, exited Thunderbird and relaunched it. But when it came back up in the original profile, none of my client's custom folders, containing years worth of carefully organized emails, appeared. Only the Inbox, Trash, etc., with the same problem of not displaying the body text.

So my first objective is to get my client's custom folders to display as they had before I created the second profile; my next objective is to try to get the body text to display in his messages. Any suggestions welcome! The profile folder is located on a file server, and is fully accessible by the PC, with full permissions. Thanks!
creator: jckadyk

title: Nextcloud Calendar Display Issue in Thunderbird - Distinguishing Event vs. Task-Only Calendars
content:
Hello everyone,

I’m synchronizing Nextcloud calendars with Thunderbird via CalDAV. My Nextcloud setup includes both standard event calendars and calendars dedicated solely to tasks, but Thunderbird imports them all without any visual or functional distinction between the two types.

How can I configure Thunderbird (or use an add-on) to:

Display task-only calendars differently from event calendars?

Filter or group calendars by type (events vs. tasks)?

Any guidance on settings, extensions or workflow changes would be greatly appreciated.

Regards, GT
